text: Activation of a novel gene in 3q21 and identification of intergenic fusion transcripts with ecotropic viral insertion site I in leukemia .

We have identified a novel gene , <extra_id_0> GR6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , located within the leukemia breakpoint region of 3q21 , that is normally expressed in early fetal development but not in adult peripheral blood .
<extra_id_0> GR6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is activated in the UCSD-AML1 cell line and in a leukemic sample , both of which carry a t ( 3 ; 3 ) ( q21 ; q26 ) .

In UCSD-AML1 , we have also identified fusion transcripts between the <extra_id_0> ecotropic viral insertion site I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> EVI1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) gene in 3q26 and <extra_id_0> GR6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and between <extra_id_0> EVI1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Ribophorin I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> that maps 30 kb telomeric to <extra_id_0> GR6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in 3q21 .

All fusions splice the 5 ' ends of the 3q21 genes into exon 2 of the <extra_id_0> EVI1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene , an event that is similar to the normal intergenic splicing of <extra_id_0> MDS1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> EVI1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and to those previously documented in leukemias with t ( 3 ; 21 ) and t ( 3 ; 12 ) , in which <extra_id_0> acute myelogenous leukemia 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> EVI1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> fusions and <extra_id_0> ETV6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> EVI1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> fusions , respectively , occur .
The <extra_id_0> Ribophorin I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> EVI1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> fusion in particular may be a common occurrence in t ( 3 ; 3 ) .
